nodes.name: project

nodes.name: study
nodes.description: A coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data, with the ultimate goal of discovery or hypothesis testing.

properties.name: associated_study
properties.description: The submitter_id or id for any study with which this study is associated, paired, or matched.

properties.name: data_description
properties.description: A brief, free-text description of the data files and associated metadata provided for this study.

properties.name: longitudinal
properties.description: Indicates whether the study has longitudinal or time-series data

properties.name: study_description
properties.description: A brief, free-text description or abstract of the study being performed. For example, the hypothesis being tested and a very brief description of the materials, methods and results.

properties.name: study_design
properties.description: Summary of the goals the study is designed to discover. General description of the study's place in relation to a clinical application.

properties.name: study_objective
properties.description: The general objective of the study. What the study hopes to discover or determine through testing.

properties.name: study_setup
properties.description: A high level description of the setup used to achieve the study objectives.

properties.name: study_url
properties.description: A URL for the study's source data or the contributing organization's website.

properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'study' table.

properties.name: study.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'study' table.

nodes.description: A file related to the study that provides additional context such as documentation, notes, reference files, data dictionaries, or supplementary files or figures.

nodes.name: subject
nodes.description: The collection of all data related to a specific subject in the context of a specific experiment.

properties.name: accession
properties.description: The subject's accession ID or number.

properties.name: age_at_enrollment
properties.description: The age of the study subject at enrollment; must be less than 90 years.

properties.name: age_at_enrollment_gt89
properties.description: The age of the subject at enrollment is greater than 89 years.

properties.description: The age of the study subject at immigration, if the age is less than 90 years.

properties.name: birth_year
properties.description: The subject's birth year.

properties.name: collaboration_id

properties.name: comments
properties.description: Any extra comments or notes about this subject.

properties.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Date and the date subject immigrated To North America.

properties.name: days_to_lost_to_followup
properties.description: The number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was lost to follow-up.

properties.name: death_year
properties.description: The subject's death year.

properties.name: ethnicity
properties.description: An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: ethnicity_other
properties.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for ethnicity, Ethnicity (free text).

properties.name: experimental_group
properties.description: The group into which this subject has been classified for this study.

properties.name: gender
properties.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

properties.name: handedness
properties.description: Handedness of the subject.

properties.name: index_date
properties.description: The reference or anchor date used during date obfuscation, where a single date is obscurred by creating one or more date ranges in relation to this date.

properties.name: index_event_status
properties.description: A measure of our confidence that the logitundinal structure of the study is well described as data-defined or via curation.

properties.name: lost_to_followup

properties.name: place_of_birth

properties.name: primary_site
properties.description: The primary anatomical site of disease in the subject.

properties.name: race
properties.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: race_other
properties.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for race, free text to describe race as collected.

nodes.name: imaging_file
nodes.description: Data file containing a diagnostic image from a clinical imaging exam.

properties.name: AccelNumReferenceLines
properties.description: Acceleration number of reference lines.

properties.name: AccelerationFactorPE
properties.description: Acceleration factor in the phase encode direction.

properties.name: AcquisitionMatrix
properties.description: Dimensions of the acquired frequency phase data before reconstruction. Multi-valued (frequency, rowsfrequency, columnsphase, rowsphase) columns. DICOM Tag 0018, 1310.

properties.name: DeviceSerialNumber
properties.description: The device serial number.

properties.name: EchoTime
properties.description: Time in ms between the middle of the excitation pulse and the peak of the echo produced (kx=0). In the case of segmented k-space, the TE(eff) is the time between the middle of the excitation pulse to the peak of the echo that is used to cover the center of k-space (i.e.,-kx=0, ky=0). DICOM Tag 0018, 0081.

properties.name: EchoTrainLength
properties.description: Number of lines in k-space acquired per excitation of the same volume regardless of the type of echo or the number of frames derived from them. DICOM Tag 0018, 0091.

properties.name: FlipAngle
properties.description: Flip angle for the acquisition, specified in degrees. DICOM Tag 0018, 1314 Flip Angle.

properties.name: ImageType
properties.description: The ImageType specified for a DICOM file.

properties.name: ImagingFrequency
properties.description: Imaging Frequency

properties.name: InPlanePhaseEncodingDirection
properties.description: The axes of the in-plane phase encoding with respect to the frame. DICOM Tag 0018, 1312.

properties.name: InversionTime
properties.description: The inversion time (TI) for the acquisition, specified in seconds. Inversion time is the time after the middle of inverting RF pulse to middle of excitation pulse to detect the amount of longitudinal magnetization. Corresponds to DICOM Tag 0018, 0082 Inversion Time (please note that the DICOM term is in milliseconds not seconds).

properties.name: MRAcquisitionType
properties.description: Identification of data encoding scheme. DICOM Tag 0018, 0023.

properties.name: MagneticFieldStrength
properties.description: Nominal field strength of MR magnet in Tesla. DICOM Tag 0018, 0087

properties.name: ManufacturerModelName
properties.description: Manufacturer's model name of the equipment that produced the composite instances. Corresponds to DICOM Tag 0008, 1090 Manufacturers Model Name.

properties.name: NumberOfAverages
properties.description: Number of times a given pulse sequence is repeated before any parameter is changed. DICOM Tag 0018, 0083.

properties.name: NumberOfPhaseEncodingSteps
properties.description: Total number of lines in k-space in the 'y' direction collected during acquisition. DICOM Tag 0018, 0089.

properties.name: PatientPosition
properties.description: Description of imaging subject's position relative to the equipment. DICOM Tag 0018, 5100

properties.name: PercentPhaseFieldOfView
properties.description: Ratio of field of view dimension in phase direction to field of view dimension in frequency direction, expressed as a percent. DICOM Tag 0018, 0094.

properties.name: PercentSampling
properties.description: Fraction of acquisition matrix lines acquired, expressed as a percent. DICOM Tag 0018, 0093

properties.name: PhaseEncodingDirection
properties.description: Possible values are i, j, k, i-, j-, k-. The letters i, j, k correspond to the first, second and third axis of the data in the NIFTI file. The polarity of the phase encoding is assumed to go from zero index to maximum index unless - sign is present (then the order is reversed - starting from the highest index instead of zero). PhaseEncodingDirection is defined as the direction along which phase is was modulated which may result in visible distortions. Note that this is not the same as the DICOM term InPlanePhaseEncodingDirection which can have ROW or COL values. This parameter is REQUIRED if corresponding fieldmap data is present or when using multiple runs with different phase encoding directions (which can be later used for field inhomogeneity correction).

properties.name: PixelBandwidth
properties.description: Reciprocal of the total sampling period, in hertz per pixel. DICOM Tag 0018, 0095.

properties.name: ProtocolName
properties.description: Description of the conditions under which the Series was performed. DICOM Tag 0018, 1030.

properties.name: ReceiveCoilName
properties.description: Information describing the receiver coil. Corresponds to DICOM Tag 0018, 1250 Receive Coil Name, although not all vendors populate that DICOM Tag, in which case this field can be derived from an appropriate private DICOM field.

properties.name: RepetitionTime
properties.description: The time in seconds between the beginning of an acquisition of one volume and the beginning of acquisition of the volume following it (TR). Please note that this definition includes time between scans (when no data has been acquired) in case of sparse acquisition schemes. This value needs to be consistent with the pixdim[4] field (after accounting for units stored in xyzt_units field) in the NIfTI header. This field is mutually exclusive with VolumeTiming and is derived from DICOM Tag 0018, 0080 and converted to seconds.

properties.name: ScanOptions
properties.description: Parameters of ScanningSequence. Corresponds to DICOM Tag 0018, 0022 Scan Options.

properties.name: ScanningSequence
properties.description: Description of the type of data acquired. Corresponds to DICOM Tag 0018, 0020 Scanning Sequence.

properties.name: SequenceName
properties.description: Manufacturers designation of the sequence name. Corresponds to DICOM Tag 0018, 0024 Sequence Name.

properties.name: SequenceVariant
properties.description: Variant of the ScanningSequence. Corresponds to DICOM Tag 0018, 0021 Sequence Variant.

properties.name: SoftwareVersions
properties.description: Manufacturers designation of software version of the equipment that produced the composite instances. Corresponds to DICOM Tag 0018, 1020 Software Versions.

properties.name: TotalScanTimeSec
properties.description: Total time of the scan in seconds.

properties.name: TransmitCoilName
properties.description: Name of transmit coil used. DICOM Tag 0018, 1251.

properties.name: VariableFlipAngleFlag
properties.description: Flip angle variation applied during image acquisition. DICOM Tag 0018, 1315.

properties.name: body_part_examined
properties.description: Part of the body that was studied.

properties.name: data_category
properties.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

properties.name: data_format
properties.description: Format of the data files.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: Specific content type of the data file.

properties.name: days_to_image
properties.description: Days from the subject's index event to the date the image was acquired.

properties.name: echo_time
properties.description: The time (milliseconds) between the application of the radiofrequency excitation pulse and the peak of the signal induced in the coil.

properties.name: field_angle
properties.description: the angle of excitation for a field echo pulse sequence.

properties.name: field_strength
properties.description: The field strength (in Tesla, T) of the MRI magnet.

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

properties.name: fov
properties.description: Field-of-view (FOV); the distance (in cm or mm) over which an MR image is acquired or displayed. The FOV is typically divided into several hundred picture elements (pixels), each approximately 1 mm² in size.

properties.name: imaging_subtype
properties.description: The subtype of imaging exam performed, for example, "T1-Weighted".

properties.name: imaging_type
properties.description: The type of imaging exam performed, for example, "CT Scan","MRI","Ultrasound","fMRI".

properties.name: instrument_manufacturer
properties.description: The imaging instrument or scanner manufacturer.

properties.name: instrument_model
properties.description: The imaging instrument or scanner model.

properties.name: inversion_time
properties.description: The time period (TI; milliseconds) between the 180° inversion pulse and the 90° excitation pulse in an inversion recovery pulse sequence. The inversion time controls the signal of different tissues.

properties.name: magnification
properties.description: Magnification used to capture the image.

properties.name: matrix_size
properties.description: The matrix size is the number of frequency encoding steps, in one direction; and the number of phase encoding steps, in the other direction of the image plane. Assuming everything else is constant, increasing the number of frequency encodings or the number of phase steps results in improved resolution.

properties.name: md5sum
properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number used as a file's digital fingerprint.

properties.name: modality
properties.description: Mode instrument was in during image acquisition.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

properties.name: pulse_sequence
properties.description: The name of the particular instrument setting of pulse sequences and pulsed field gradients (e.g., "GRE" (gradient echo), "SE" (spin echo), or "IR" (inversion-recovery), etc.).

properties.name: repetition_time
properties.description: The repetition time (TR; milliseconds) is the time from the application of an excitation pulse to the application of the next pulse. It determines how much longitudinal magnetization recovers between each pulse.

properties.name: scan_id
properties.description: The identification number for a stack of images generated during a single scan.

properties.name: storage_urls
properties.description: A list of URLs where the file is stored in the cloud.

properties.name: study_date
properties.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

properties.name: visit_id
properties.description: The submitter_id of a subject's visit in the study.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'imaging_file' table.

properties.name: imaging_file.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'imaging_file' table.

nodes.name: sample
nodes.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products. In the case of contrived samples, it describes any material obtained from a normal donor.

properties.name: anatomic_site
properties.description: The term that best describes the primary anatomic site of the collected sample.

properties.name: anatomic_site_other
properties.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for 'anatomic_site', enter the anatomic site here.

properties.name: comments
properties.description: General comments about the sample or sampling procedure.

properties.name: composition
properties.description: The term that best describes the composition of the sample.

properties.name: days_to_collection
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Event and the date the sample was collected.

properties.name: days_to_frozen
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Event and the date the sample was frozen.

properties.name: days_to_shipped
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Event and the date the sample was shipped.

properties.name: device_used
properties.description: List device(s) used for procuring the sample.

properties.name: fasting_status
properties.description: Fasting Status at the time of sample collection

properties.name: laterality
properties.description: The side of the organ or body the biospecimen was taken from (e.g., 'Left' if 'anatomic_site' was 'Lung' and it was taken from the left lung)

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: The text term that describes the method used to preserve the biospecimen after collection.

properties.name: procured_or_purchased
properties.description: Was the biospecimen purchased from a vendor or procured from a study participant.

nodes.name: visit
nodes.description: A record of a study subject's visit to or remote contact with a medical professional or study administrator to capture time-based data from longitudinal studies. A clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures and assessments that may be performed on a subject. A visit has a start and an end, each described with a rule. The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained before and after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

properties.name: days_to_visit
properties.description: The number of days between the case Index Date and the date of the visit, call or other interaction.

properties.name: days_to_visit_end
properties.description: The number of days from the index date to the date the patient's visit ended.

properties.name: days_to_visit_start
properties.description: The number of days from the index date to the date the patient's visit began.

properties.name: months_between_visits
properties.description: The number of months between the case Index Date and the date  of the visit, call or other interaction

properties.name: visit_duration
properties.description: The number of days from the start date of the visit to the end date of the visit.

properties.name: visit_epoch
properties.description: If a single visit is sub-divided into multiple time-points or epochs, or if an unscheduled visit takes place between two integer-labeled visits, specify the order of such sub-divisions, timepoints, or unscheduled visits here. For example, specify 'visit_number' of '1' and 'visit_epoch' of '2' for 'Visit 1.2'. If there is no sub-division of a single visit into multiple timepoints or unscheduled visits between numbered visits, submit only 'visit_number'.

properties.name: visit_id
properties.description: The submitter_id of a subject's visit in the study.

properties.name: visit_label
properties.description: The reason for or context of the visit, call or other interaction. For a generic visit, specify "Visit".

properties.name: visit_label_other
properties.description: The reason for or context of the visit, call or other interaction, if 'Other (specify)' was chosen for 'visit_label'.

properties.name: visit_method
properties.description: The way the visit took place, whether in person or remotely.

properties.name: visit_method_other
properties.description: The way the visit took place, if 'Other (specify)' was chosen for 'visit_method'.

properties.name: visit_number
properties.description: The order number of this visit in relation to other visits. For example, if this is 'Visit 2' out of 'Visit 1, Visit 2, ..., Visit N', then specify a 'visit_number' of '2'. See 'visit_epoch' to specify sub-divisions of a single visit. For example, if observations were made every hour during a 3 hour visit, specify a 'visit_epoch' of '1','2', and '3' with the same 'visit_number' to record each hour's observations.

properties.name: visit_scheduled
properties.description: Specify whether the visit was scheduled or unscheduled.

properties.name: visit_type
properties.description: Text term used to describe the type of visit.

properties.name: visit_units
properties.description: If a visit is defined by a given interval of time, specify the time interval. For example, for a visit defined as 'Month 6 Visit', specify 'Month' for 'visit_units' and specify '6' for 'visit_number'.

properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'visit' table.

properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'visit' table.
